definition: warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near

sentences.english: Moonlight Senran, spirit temperament, everything is just a mirage, transient.
sentences.chinese: 月光的森然，樂律的精魂，一切只是幻影，稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: Or even if you do, you make sure that it’s as fleeting as it can be.
sentences.chinese: 即使你這樣做了，那也會稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: AYA, life for you is too short.
sentences.chinese: 亞也，對你來說生命更加短暫，稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: It is readily available, but fleeting.
sentences.chinese: 它已經垂手可得，卻稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: Aesthetics are fleeting, the only things with longevity are ideas.
sentences.chinese: 美學稍縱即逝，唯一永恆的是思想。

sentences.english: These are the fleeting moments of real joy.
sentences.chinese: 這些是稍縱即逝的真實快樂。

sentences.english: We know that love can be fleeting.
Friday's victory, however, will almost certainly be fleeting.
sentences.chinese: 週五勝利的機會，也差點稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: But opportunities like the social Web come along only so often.
sentences.chinese: 但是，像社交網絡這樣的機遇可謂稍縱即逝。

sentences.english: Our opportunities to obey God's promptings are also fleeting.
sentences.chinese: 我們遵行上帝指示的機會同樣也是稍縱即逝。

definition: lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
